page.title: 18WRITTLE, KING JOHN'S PALACE
page.content: Undoubtedly one of Writtle's most important historic sites is the moated area known as King John's Palace. The area is situated within the grounds of the Agricultural College and has been preserved to show the moat. It was originally built by King John in the year 1211. Detailed records of the royal household expenditure for the time show that the original lodge was built at a cost of Â£13.6s.8d. King Henry the Third and King Edward the First were both regular visitors to the lodge and a number of items from this period have been found there.
